page.title: Questions - Content Questions
page.introduction: Content questions differ from Yes/No questions in that they contain an interrogative word or phrase, known as wh-phrases in English because they almost all begin with wh (who, what, why, where, when, how, which).

form.prompt: Key a list of the interrogative words in your language and their gloss here:
form.instruction: Go to the lexicon and mark each of the interrogative words with the feature wh.
form.introduction:
In languages like English, the interrogative word or phrase must be fronted. In the trees, this fronting will be to the specifier of CP. Sample trees for main clause and embedded content questions in English are shown here:
Click here for more information about the CP phrase structure of content questions.
Some examples of English main clause content questions are:

EnglishExample.exItem: Who might have hit the ball?

form.prompt: Key similar examples from your language here:
form.introduction: Examples of English embedded content questions include:

EnglishExample.exItem: I know who hit the ball.
I know when she will come.
I know what the boy hit.
